silhouette.shapes
Class LineShape

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--silhouette.constraints.constrainedObject
        |
        +--silhouette.shapes.AbstractSilShape
              |
              +--silhouette.shapes.LineShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
SilShape
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArrowLineShape
public class LineShape
extends AbstractSilShape

A line that is drawn on the screen. In addition to the properties of a normal Silhouette shape, a line also has the following properties:

  1. x1, y1: The first endpoint
  2. x2, y2: The second endpoint

Method Detail

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draws a line shape to the screen. This method should never be called directly by an application. To get a line shape to appear on the screen, either add it to a Silhouette canvas or to a composite shape that has been added to a Silhouette canvas.
Overrides:
draw in class AbstractSilShape

getIntersectPoint

public java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double getIntersectPoint(SilShape fromObj)
A line drawn from the center of the fromObj to the center of this line will intersect this line at its center. Hence return the center point of this line as the intersection point.
Overrides:
getIntersectPoint in class AbstractSilShape
